page.title: 02OVERVIEW-PEOPLE IN SOUTH FEN
page.content: With one exception the whole area is down to agricultural use under the ownership of four very large farms. The crops are mainly cereal and root with a few sheep grazing the river banks. The exception is the large scrapyard/foundry and haulage business run by two brothers on ajoining land. Two roads cross the area from west to east, the main A151 from Bourne to Spalding and a small country lane from Bourne to Tongue End and on,eventually to either Spalding via Pode Hole or Baston. There is no direct vehicular link between Tongue End and Twenty. Remains may also be found of the rail- way trackbed, the line having been closed in the nineteen-sixties. The inhabitants are mostly employed on the local farms with only a few travelling to either of the neighbour- ing towns or the local scrapyard.
